alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 11:02AM EDT until June 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. .Heavy rainfall across Upstate, western North Carolina and the Midlands has produced rises on the area rivers. Rainfall amounts from 2 to 4 inches with highers amounts up to 7 inches have fallen over the past 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 107.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 118.4 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT.
